definition: Feminism is being aware and supportive of women and their historical struggle - while feeling good about being masculine. It's not one or the other, both are possible and worth pursuing. Anyone who says otherwise is bitter.
What do you need today? Be direct
Men and women can be equally as monstrous. Challenge people who say women are better than men, same as you would vice versa.
Gregg Wallace is one man, Marie Le Pen is one woman.
Mums don't "always know" - nobody does.
You're annoying, extremely stubborn and independent, lazy, frustratingly slow, rude, inconsistent, moody - but clearly extremely lovable despite this.

Making music is a great way to spend your time, no matter your state of employment. However, without a life outside of this, the music will probably be boring. What you channel into music is what makes it interesting.
I don’t care what age my friends are. Why would I hang out with someone my own age I don’t like, rather than someone younger or older that I do? I like a broad range of perspectives.

Men can be passionate. You're like a skinny white boy Tony Soprano

An unexamined life is to live by other people’s standards. Too much thinking is madness. Find a middle
Don’t necessarily take the obvious choice -  go for what specifically you want.
Life is playful, like an ongoing piece of music. The idea is not to strive for the pot at the end of the rainbow, some end goal where you have “everything”, but to enjoy the process.
I value self-exploration through art and philosophy. I want to understand myself
“In my music, I'm trying to play the truth of what I am. The reason it's difficult is because I'm changing all the time.”

Frame Justifying: trying to mitigate or explain why your status is better than it looks, anxiously. A form of reframing. Eg. ‘I work in hospitality but I’m an Assistant General Manager with a salary.’ Eg. ‘I’m a rich kid but I’ve made my own way and had no help. Self made man.’ We try to cover up low status chips to our frame. This only comes across as insecure. Be honest and direct. ‘I have some wealth, I pursued my passion in my 20s. Who wouldn’t?’. No reframing.

Accolades and achievements are seductive for your self worth. It's tempting to fall back on these in hard times ‘well at least I did x, y or z’ - but why not have self worth for simply being? In the same way, why attach negative self esteem to bad past experiences ‘I fucked up a, b or c’. All of this is framing, what information may or may not make you look better, but inside you should have consistent self worth. Try to distance your own self worth from accoladdes and failures in the real world.
We’re all going to die. Houses will be ruins, successes forgotten. What matters?

Is sex to you proving you are on a high, or higher rung of the ladder than either you are, or claim to be? Is sex an anxious peacock display of status and capitalist success - what kind of person will you attract if you beleive this?

Productivity is not just economic. Self-anaylsing and reflecting, taking time in isolation to confront yourself and your fears, for instance, could yield high rewards such as improved self-worth from a small investment, like a walk in the park. Reclaim productivity

To me, a loser is someone who lives by a set of values not their own, not taking risks, confronting themselves in order to grow and playing the victim. In order to know your values however, you may need to go through phases of being a “loser”, be tested, to realize what your values even are. It's ok to have a bumpy ride, we're all losers sometimes.
Be a socialist who isn't an idealist. An artist who isn't mad
Would you be offended if a gnat bit you?

Learning is a love of knowing. You could do this as a child, adult, or old person. Even if you had a year to live, if learning was what you wanted then do it, even if you never get to use it. It’s ok to just enjoy learning for it’s own sake.

If the raw animal inside of you believes something, the ‘shadow’ - and this belief does not contradict social norms - embody it immediately. Eg. “You can go to university at any age” - I believe that in my subconscious, and although it's unconventional, it's not ostracising as a belief. So say it without fear. Otherwise, at the very least acknowledge and respect that it's there, integrate and test it.
A broad range of friends gives a broad range of perspectives. Age, culture, gender, sexual preferences.
The arc of the conversation is often more important than the conclusion. Philosophy is exercise not truth.
There is no true belief system, we wander from belief to belief, using it as a lens to help us understand ourselves.
What kind of person do you want to be like?
Don’t prove yourself. Live by your own values and don't attach yourself to your frame. If how you seem is rotten to one person or group, it's almost certainly great to someone else.
Nothing wrong with feeling painful or grand emotions. You're a passionate person

Too much emphasis on how much: how many records does this DJ own; how many books have you read on this or that subject. Reading one book, or listening to one record and dedicating time to it is better. I don't need to see and hear it all, if it means sacrificing the depth of understanding. No one likes a mr or miss know it all who's always putting their hand up.
Are you judging anyone for their status, health, age, beauty or anything else? Keep an eye out

Help yourself and your kids first, then other adults. What do you need today?
Cats go after what they want. We love them for it, even if it drives us mad.
"Still single?" is like asking "still in a relationship?". Much more important is are you happy or doing a good job in either one.
Why fantasise about proving yourself to someone - who cares what they think - what do you want?
Accept all parts of yourself, especially the repressed parts
It's ok to surrender sometimes. You fucked it. Everyone does from time to time, you're not impervious
If you make a committment today to someone, keep it
Don't let the bastards grind you down

Everyone has a different frame, which can be judged as high or low status. See frames as interchangable, swappable. Does the person underneath, including yourself, deserve respect as a human being, equal treatment?

Rungs on ladders: steadily climbing; tearfully slipping; anxiously clinging. At the top, I'd 'make it' - but make what? A loft conversion, an IKEA showroom filled with browsers: love only for my finances; friends only of my successes. Let go of this ladder to heaven, legs unbroken.
Approach potential lovers with curiosity
I don't believe a girl needs to be successful, have high status, great material assets or money in the bank, for me to love her. I'm looking for the same.
Men keep saying - 'women only want men with large salaries'. These men have met every woman
Don't put yourself down. Speak from the gut

Being single is great. You wake up, you eat some eggs, go to the movies, go out, maybe have some sex. Being in a relationship is great. You wake up, you eat some eggs, go to the movies, go out, maybe have some sex.
Don't assume, make your own conclusions

Stop trying to do things 'the right way' or 'be sensible' and expect results. There is no contract that avoids failure and creates stability from following well troden paths. What's something only you could think to do?
Opportunites and options kill desperation and regret. How can you give yourself more opportunites or options?

I am superficial. Someone with a new flashy job feels impressive to me. If I found out you were famous, I would look at you different. I am also a reverse snob, I despise myself and others for not treating people as equals. Both are extreme, so try to be in the middle. Playfully superficial.
